content.description: The x axis ranges from 0 to 4 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 5 to 7 in increments of 1. Two dashed lines are shown as well as two plotted points.
content.question: One dashed line extends from (0 comma 7) to (4 comma negative 5). The other dashed line extends from (0 comma negative 5) to (4 comma 7). The two lines intersect at the point (2 comma 1). One point is plotted at (1 comma 1), and the other point is plotted at (3 comma 1). The figure shows the asymptotes and the vertices for the graph of a hyperbola (not shown) that opens left and right in the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane. Which of the following could be a parametrization of the hyperbola for <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 2 pi"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></math> ? (The asymptotes pass through the center of the hyperbola, which is located an equal distance from both vertices.)

choices.label: <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses equals 1 plus 2 cos t"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>cos</mi><mi>t</mi></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses equals 3 minus sin t"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>-</mo><mi>sin</mi><mi>t</mi></math>

<math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses equals 2 plus cos t"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>cos</mi><mi>t</mi></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses equals 1 minus 3 sin t"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>sin</mi><mi>t</mi></math>

<math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses equals 1 plus 2 sec t"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>sec</mi><mi>t</mi></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses equals 3 minus tan t"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>-</mo><mi>tan</mi><mi>t</mi></math>

<math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses equals 2 plus sec t"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>sec</mi><mi>t</mi></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses equals 1 minus 3 tan t"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>tan</mi><mi>t</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses equals 2 plus sec t"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>sec</mi><mi>t</mi></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses equals 1 minus 3 tan t"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>tan</mi><mi>t</mi></math>

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
